Fit a stats::gl without carying back large structures.

Source: R/clean_fit.R
clean_fit_lm.Rd

Fit a stats::gl without carying back large structures.

clean_fit_lm(outcome, variables, data, ..., weights = NULL,
  env = baseenv())

Arguments

outcome

character, name of outcome column.
variables

character, names of varaible columns.
data

data.frame, training data.
...

not used, force later arguments to be used by name
weights

passed to stats::glm()
env

environment to work in.

Value

list(model=model, summary=summary)

Examples


k = 1000
dlarge <- data.frame(
  x1 = rep(c("a", "a", "b", "b"), k),
  x2 = rep(c(0, 0, 0, 1), k),
  y = rep(1:4, k),
  yC = rep(c(FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE), k),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
dsmall <- data.frame(
  x1 = c("a", "a", "b", "b"),
  x2 = c(0, 0, 0, 1),
  y = 1:4,
  yC = c(FALSE, TRUE, TRUE, TRUE),
  stringsAsFactors = FALSE)
res_lm <- clean_fit_lm("y", c("x1", "x2"), dlarge)
str(res_lm$model)
#> List of 8
#>  $ coefficients: Named num [1:3] 1.5 1.5 1
#>   ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:3] "(Intercept)" "x1b" "x2"
#>  $ rank        : int 3
#>  $ assign      : int [1:3] 0 1 2
#>  $ qr          :List of 4
#>   ..$ qraux: num [1:3] 1.02 1.02 1.02
#>   ..$ pivot: int [1:3] 1 2 3
#>   ..$ tol  : num 1e-07
#>   ..$ rank : int 3
#>   ..- attr(*, "class")= chr "qr"
#>  $ df.residual : int 3997
#>  $ contrasts   :List of 1
#>   ..$ x1: chr "contr.treatment"
#>  $ xlevels     :List of 1
#>   ..$ x1: chr [1:2] "a" "b"
#>  $ terms       :Classes 'terms', 'formula'  language y ~ x1 + x2
#>   .. ..- attr(*, "variables")= language list(y, x1, x2)
#>   .. ..- attr(*, "factors")= int [1:3, 1:2] 0 1 0 0 0 1
#>   .. .. ..- attr(*, "dimnames")=List of 2
#>   .. .. .. ..$ : chr [1:3] "y" "x1" "x2"
#>   .. .. .. ..$ : chr [1:2] "x1" "x2"
#>   .. ..- attr(*, "term.labels")= chr [1:2] "x1" "x2"
#>   .. ..- attr(*, "order")= int [1:2] 1 1
#>   .. ..- attr(*, "intercept")= int 1
#>   .. ..- attr(*, "response")= int 1
#>   .. ..- attr(*, ".Environment")=<environment: base> 
#>   .. ..- attr(*, "predvars")= language list(y, x1, x2)
#>   .. ..- attr(*, "dataClasses")= Named chr [1:4] "numeric" "character" "numeric" "numeric"
#>   .. .. ..- attr(*, "names")= chr [1:4] "y" "x1" "x2" "(weights)"
#>  - attr(*, "class")= chr "lm"
predict(res_lm$model, newdata = dsmall)
#>   1   2   3   4 
#> 1.5 1.5 3.0 4.0
